title: 26 Best Affordable Couches in 2025 That Look Expensive
description: All sorts of steals for under $2,000
author: Erika Owen, Audrey Lee
excerpt: We scoured the internet for the best affordable couches under $2,000, including sectionals and chaises from West Elm, Article, Wayfair, and beyond.
text: All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.Something you realize pretty quickly when diving into the wide world of furniture shopping is that finding the best affordable couches will take time (and lots of browsing). Thankfully, there are a wealth of options in the sub-$2,000 sofa category, if your budget is only netting you…approximately half an accent chair these days.With a slew of direct-to-consumer companies offering sofas minus the middle man and big-box retailers shilling flat-pack options at a fair price point, there are a bunch of budget-friendly options at your disposal. Just remember to factor in shipping costs, along with any customization services and white-glove delivery.Combing through all of the affordable couches to find The One to tie your living room together can prove onerous, especially with so much junk out there. But don’t fret. We’ve sorted all the best budget-friendly sofas that look a lot more expensive than they actually are.Our Top PicksBest Overall: Article Abisko Sofa, $1,199Most Comfortable: West Elm Osborn Sofa, $1,499Best Sectional: Honbay U-Shaped Sectional Sleeper Couch With Storage Chaise, $1,309Best Sleeper Sofa: Article Nordby Sofa Bed, $1,599Best Chaise: Castlery Jonathan Right Chaise, $1,099Whether your interior design taste leans tailored and midcentury modern, or cozy and maximalist, we did the digging for you to surface several budget-friendly candidates for your new couch. Without further ado, a short list of the finest picks we could find for less than $2,000.And if you’re looking for a couch at a certain price point, click below to jump to a specific section.Under $1,000 | $1,000 — $1,500 | $1,500 — $2,000The Best Affordable Couches Under $1,000Modway Engage Mid-Century Modern LoveseatDimensions: 33"D x 78"W x 32.5"HSeat depth: 25"Materials: Polyester, foam, woodColors: Gray, red, azure, beige, citrus, granite, laguna, oatmeal, teal, wheatgrassModway’s midcentury couch is one of our favorite Prime-able couches on Amazon. It has a relatively small footprint for tight spaces, and balances on solid wood legs, with a middle-of-the-road seat depth that works for petites and people of average height. It also arrives in a handy slipcover when it ships out, so your sofa stays clean and pristine en route.AllModern Aquarius Upholstered SofaDimensions: 32.7'' H X 85.1'' W X 37.8'' DSeat depth: 30.3''Materials: Velvet, foam, rubberwood, pineColors: Rust, pistachio, light gray, light blueAllModern’s Aquarius sofa isn’t quite as rebellious as the star sign it’s named after, with its modern lines and bountiful cushions that cater to a wide crowd. Still, it’s got the depth to suit the name, at least when it comes to seating. It’s deep enough to really sink into when you’re dialed into a show, though shorter folks might want to choose alternative options. It’s also firm-leaning to appeal to people who want a sturdier surface to sit on.Wrought Studio Arnya Minimore SofaDimensions: 30.7'' H X 84.6'' W X 33.9'' DSeat depth: 24.4"Materials: Polyester, solid + manufactured wood, foamColors: Gray Corduroy, Orange Chenille, Pink Corduroy, White Chenille, White Corduroy, Yellow ChenilleThis cloud-like couch with over 400 five-star reviews to its credit is another intriguing option for anyone looking for maximum coziness. The sofa comes with five small round cushions that match the fluffy chenille surface and ship out in two boxes for easy assembly. At around $500, it’s a particularly nice entry-level prospect if you’re looking to experiment with the white couch lifestyle (like model Taylor Hill), but don’t want to splurge on something that might easily show stains.Serta Rane FutonDimensions: 33.1"D x 66.1"W x 29.5"HSeat depth: 19.8''Materials: Microfiber, wood, metal, high density foam, polyesterColors: Black, navy, charcoal, java, light grayWhen your budget is only $200 for a new sofa (no judgement), you could go straight to Craigslist, but chances are you just want something free of dust and wear. The mattress specialists over at Serta have just the thing: a very cheap futon made up of high-density foam and coiled springs that acts like a firm mattress. Blessed with a midcentury look, it’s the ideal not-so-expensive find for folding down in a spare room or den when you have guests come through.West Elm Penn SofaDimensions: 87"W x 29.5"D x 30.75"HSeat depth: 20.5"Materials: Kiln-dried solid pine and engineered wood frame, metal legs, high-resiliency polyurethane foam cushions, chenille upholstery (65% polyester, 35% recycled polyester)Colors: SlateThe three-seater Penn Sofa from West Elm comes in a blue-gray velvet. What it lacks in customization options, it makes up for in comfort and affordability. It comes optimally cushioned with high armrests and bold, spindly metal legs.Pottery Barn Teen Cushy Lounge Sectional SetDimensions: 64"W x 64"D x 21.5"HSeat depth: 24"Materials: Plywood and LVL frame with foam, polyester batting and fabricColors: 26 colors across six different fabric typesModular sofas like this L-shaped one are great if you want to move your furniture around, break things down into multiple single-seaters sprinkled around the room, or keep it all connected for cuddly movie nights. The possibilities are endless with how you can configure these three pieces, as well as the color and performance fabrics you can purchase them in (you can have the velvet couch of your dreams!).West Elm Mella SofaDimensions: 67.3"W x 33.3"D x 28.7"HSeat depth: 24.8"Materials: Engineered wood frame, solid rubberwood legs, cushions have fiber-wrapped, high-resiliency polyurethane foam cores, velvet or bouclé upholsteryColors: Clay, alabasterPerformance velvet, a lovely curved silhouette, and a little peek of rubberwood legs make this the kind of piece of furniture that becomes a focal point of any living space it’s parked in. Great for small apartments, the design looks high-end while maintaining minimal charm (thank you, velvet). It does run on the firmer side, which is something to keep in mind. But if you’re in the market for a comfortable sofa that’s perfect for reading, watching a movie, or hanging out with friends, well…you found it. The cushions are attached, and it’s recommended that any stains are spot-cleaned.Burrow Range 2-Piece SofaDimensions: 62"L x 31"D x 28"HSeat depth: 21"Materials: Bent plywood frame, cushions use a combination of medium-density foam, shredded fill, and fiber wadding, stain-resistant fabricColors: Stone gray, heather charcoal, navy blue, moss green, ocean, toastBurrow aims to cut out unnecessary markups while manufacturing highly customizable products with upcycled fabrics and sustainable wood. This small-space-friendly two-seater is our top choice because it’s completely customizable, from the colorways and arms to the legs (we reviewed the three-piece here).The Best Affordable Couches Between $1,000 — $1,500Quince Sierra Curved Arm SofaDimensions: 30.5"H x 84"W x 40"DSeat depth: 24"Materials: Solid wood and kiln-dried engineered wood, foam and recycled fiber, velvet or performance fabricColors: Sable, ivory, linen, gunmetal, java, caramel, rust, spruce, midnightWe’ve tested lots of essentials from Quince, so we can personally vouch for the brand’s quality. In addition to reasonably-priced sheets and loungewear, it also recently ventured into furniture. The Sierra sofa comes in three different sizes, from seven to nine feet, to accommodate different floor plans, and there's a wide range of upholstery options to curate a lighter vibe or build out a moodier space.Article Abisko Velvet SofaDimensions: 28"H x 91"W x 35"DSeat depth: 25"Materials: Frame: kiln-dried larch, plywood, brushed aluminum; Filling: high density foam, polyester fiber; Fabric: 100% polyesterColors: Pacific blue, Yarrow goldThe plush armrests on this velveteen Article sofa look like the perfect place to curl up for a nap or with a good book. The textured upholstery will inject some richness into your space, while the performance fabric makes it easy to blot out the odd stain or smudge if your living room doubles as your dining room.AllModern Luka SofaDimensions: 30.3'' H X 84.6'' W X 39.4'' DSeat depth: 39.4"Materials: Frame: solid wood, Filling: foam, Fabric: polyester blendColors: Mark cobalt, Pasha duneAnd just because you’re buying a budget sofa, doesn’t mean it has to feel like a boring beater couch. This elevated sofa in a universally flattering beige features recessed arms and a graduated base in lieu of rickety legs. It’s also made of solid wood, not MDF, despite the approachable price point.Article Sanders Velvet SofaDimensions: 32.5"H x 85.5"W x 38.5"DSeat depth: 21.5"Materials: Frame: solid pine, solid beech, plywood; Filling: polyurethane foam, polyester fiber; Fabric: 100% polyesterColors: Pacific green, Pacific brownOval velvet seat cushions make up the base and back of this squishy Article couch that beckons you to sit and sprawl out. The thin Scandi-style legs are just long enough that you can stuff some storage bins under there where the dust bunnies live, and the polyester fabric is low-absorption, so if you get a little too wild with your red wine or coffee, there’s still time to make a dash for some paper towels before it’s fully seeped in.West Elm Leroy LoveseatDimensions: 60"W x 32"D x 25.8"HSeat depth: 24.4"Materials: Solid and engineered wood frame, cushion has a fiber-wrapped, high-resiliency polyurethane foam core, upholstery (linen, velvet, or chenille options)Colors: Camel, silver, taupe, frost grayIf there’s anything West Elm does well, it’s a velvet sofa, and Leroy is just the comfy love seat for cozying up with someone or just cozying up with the special someone that is Netflix. Leroy is available in a soft velvet like the one pictured here or a number of finishes like linen, twill and chenille (so you can customize it for whatever living area it’s about to bless).Article Abisko SofaDimensions: 28"H x 91"W x 35"DSeat depth: 25"Materials: Kiln-dried larch, plywood, and brushed aluminum frame, high density foam and polyester fiber filling, poly-blend upholsteryColors: Quartz white, Welsh grayWe love all things overstuffed (hello, cloud couch trend) because they offer supreme comfort. This option from Article arrives in two separate pieces for easy moving and assembly. It has wide, cushioned armrests which can double as a pillow in a pinch. If you’re in need of a sofa that’s neutral but still ultra-comfortable, look no further.West Elm Osborn SofaDimensions: 82"W x 39.5"D x 29"HSeat depth: 27.5"Materials: Kiln-dried engineered wood frame, cushions have fiber-wrapped, high-resiliency polyurethane foam cores, upholstery (linen, basketweave, velvet, chenille, bouclé, and twill options)Colors: 34 colorways across the six fabric optionsConsider this puffy pick the Cloud Couch’s cousin. Just looking at West Elm’s Osborn sofa makes us feel relaxed and ready to curl up. The exaggerated curves feel playful, though don't and it’s firm without being uninviting. Choose from a number of fabric styles and color options, from a sandy bouclé to gray performance velvet.Albany Park Albany Leather SofaDimensions: 87"W x 32"H x 34"DSeat depth: 23"Materials: Kiln-dried hardwood frame, cushions have pocket coils surrounded by high-density, mattress-quality memory foam, vegan leatherColors: Distressed, rustAlbany Park’s signature three-seater faux leather couch is a dream for anyone who loves the look and feel of real cowskin. We can't ignore all the luxurious hues of velvet upholstery available, if that's more your style though. Plus it’s the ideal size for stretching out and reclining.Castlery Jonathan Right ChaiseDimensions: 54.7"W x 39.4D" x 27.6"HSeat depth: 24.8"Materials: Laminated veneer lumber & plywood frame, foam, fiber, pocket springs, poly-blend upholsteryColors: Creamy white, Zenith blue, dark graniteThis modern chaise is technically one part of Castlery’s modular sofas, but it can certainly stand alone in a room with other seating. It comes in a few neutral shades, as well. Push it up against a wall or nestle it near a side table, and expect a nice alternative to poufs and other low-lying seating.Caitlin Loveseat by The EverygirlDimensions: 63"W x 37D" x 31"HSeat depth: 22"Materials: Wood frame, custom fill (down blend, double down blend, down alternative options), upholstery (velvet, chenille, linen, woven, tweed, slub weave, and bouclé options)Colors: 124 color options across seven fabric typesWe’re huge fans of Interior Define’s Gaby sectional, and the brand also offers several sofas in the under $2,000 price range. The Caitlin is customizable when it comes to color, fabric, leg type, cushion type, depth, fill, and size. The Caitlin has a classic shape, but the deep-toned upholstery adds a vintage element that'll stand out in your living room.Urban Outfitters Roma SofaDimensions: 74.8"L x 33.46"W x 30"HSeat depth: 26"Materials: Rubberwood, pinewood, plywood, fabricColors: Red stripe, moss, ivory, sky, yellow stripeThe curvy bottom edge alone sold us on this one (along with the gorgeous hue). It’s playful, it’s modern, and has a soothing color and design. Plus, without any arms to speak of, it's easier to fit in tighter spaces. Fill it with throw pillows and get ready for some cozy naps.Albany Park Kova SofaDimensions: 85.5"W x 39"H x 42.5"DSeat depth: 29"Materials: Contract-grade wood frame, foam, upholstery (linen, chenille, canvas, bouclé, velvet, twill, and basketweave options)Colors: 33 colors across all fabric typesFor anyone decorating a smaller space who still wants to provide a cozy spot to nap, this pick from Albany Park certainly fits the bill. Prepare to sink into the deep hypoallergenic foam cushions for hours on end. You can choose from different fabric options—including stain-resistant, pet-friendly, and kid-friendly—all of which come in a handful of different colors.The Best Affordable Couches Between $1,500 — $2,000Article Nordby Sofa BedDimensions: 33"H x 87"W x 35"DSeat depth: 29.5"Materials: Rubberwood, plywood, steel, foam, polyester fiber, polyester upholsteryColors: Henge gray, lull blue, pep grayArticle’s Nordby took the top spot in our list of the finest sofa beds for its attractive price point and easily convertible frame that folds out into a full-size pullout bed. Its minimal look and chunky legs are easy to swallow when you’re on a tight budget and, though the sofa itself is decently firm, your guest can at least relish the fact that they’re not on a saggy air mattress when they’re sprawled out on it.Crate & Barrel Cavett Ash Wood LoveseatDimensions: 33"H x 51"W x 31"DMaterials: Soy-based polyfoam and fiber, solid ashColors: 219 colors across the fabric typesFor the person who wants a vintage-leaning piece without the hassle of haggling on 1st Dibs, there’s this mid-century Scandi loveseat that clocks in at just under $1,500. Its slender arms and cantilevered seat invite you to sit back and relax, while the solid ash frame ensures that it will be with you for the long haul.Cozey Atmosphere Collection SofaDimensions: 28.3"H x 110.6"W x 40.6"DMaterials: Solid pine, high density foam, performance fabric, chenilleColors: 15 colors across the fabric typesYou can always add more pieces to Cozey’s modular Atmosphere sofa, making it a great option for anyone looking for furniture that can adapt to their home. “I would definitely want to bring it with me to a new home, especially since it would be easy to break down into pieces and transport with a moving van,” reviewer Adrienne Jordan told us when she first reviewed the piece. Performance fabric, chenille, and boucle upholstery options further solidify its reign as one of the most customizable options on this list, and there’s even an option to nix the armrests for a more streamlined, modern look.Sabai The Essential SofaDimensions: 32"H x 85"W x 34"DSeat depth: 22"Materials: FSC Certified wood, high resiliency foam, 100% recycled fabrics (hemp blend, cactus leather, recycled velvet, upcycled polyester, and hemp options)Colors: 22 colors across the fabric typesNot only does the Essential Sofa from Sabai have a fairly wallet-friendly price tag, it also has serious sustainability cred. The solid wood frame is made of FSC-certified lumber, the foam-filling is CertiPUR-certified, and the pillows are made of recycled fiber fill. Plus it leans into a classic silhouette that’ll fit any decor style, featuring square arms and one long foam cushion. It’s a green flag in our book!Crate & Barrel Pacific Armless Sofa with Wood LegsDimensions: 17.5"H x 71.5"W x 23"DSeat depth: 23"Materials: FSC-certified solid and engineered hardwood, high-resilient foam wrapped in polyfiber, upholstery (chenille, textured weave, microfiber, linen weave, twill, velvet, canvas, bouclé, plain weave, shearling)Colors: 262 colors across the fabric typesAnything with cute, chunky legs is going to add some personality to your space—and make it look more expensive. This armless seat is anchored by square, wooden legs and you even get to choose between a variety of color ways (we love the look of natural rubberwood). The taller back cushion offers up some serious support, whether you’re lounging or working. Plus, the armless construction means the couch will prove a little easier to fit into tighter spaces.CB2 Strato Velvet SofaDimensions: 27.5"H x 80"W x 38"DSeat depth: 26.75"Materials: Kiln-dried engineered wood, high density foam cushions, cotton-poly blend velvet upholsteryColors: Camel, whiteWe’ll give you a second to take in this ‘70s-inspired beauty. Yes, it comes in right at $1,999, but it makes a statement without being so trendy you’ll want to sell it on Facebook Marketplace next year. Framed in solid wood and ensconced in camel velvet, this two-seater sofa lasts for the long haul.
html:
All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.

Something you realize pretty quickly when diving into the wide world of furniture shopping is that finding the best affordable couches will take time (and lots of browsing). Thankfully, there are a wealth of options in the sub-$2,000 sofa category, if your budget is only netting you…approximately half an accent chair these days.

With a slew of direct-to-consumer companies offering sofas minus the middle man and big-box retailers shilling flat-pack options at a fair price point, there are a bunch of budget-friendly options at your disposal. Just remember to factor in shipping costs, along with any customization services and white-glove delivery.

Combing through all of the affordable couches to find The One to tie your living room together can prove onerous, especially with so much junk out there. But don’t fret. We’ve sorted all the best budget-friendly sofas that look a lot more expensive than they actually are.

Our Top Picks

  • Best Overall: Article Abisko Sofa, $1,199
  • Most Comfortable: West Elm Osborn Sofa, $1,499
  • Best Sectional: Honbay U-Shaped Sectional Sleeper Couch With Storage Chaise, $1,309
  • Best Sleeper Sofa: Article Nordby Sofa Bed, $1,599
  • Best Chaise: Castlery Jonathan Right Chaise, $1,099

Whether your interior design taste leans tailored and midcentury modern, or cozy and maximalist, we did the digging for you to surface several budget-friendly candidates for your new couch. Without further ado, a short list of the finest picks we could find for less than $2,000.

And if you’re looking for a couch at a certain price point, click below to jump to a specific section.

Under $1,000 | $1,000 — $1,500 | $1,500 — $2,000

The Best Affordable Couches Under $1,000

Modway Engage Mid-Century Modern Loveseat

  • Dimensions: 33"D x 78"W x 32.5"H
  • Seat depth: 25"
  • Materials: Polyester, foam, wood
  • Colors: Gray, red, azure, beige, citrus, granite, laguna, oatmeal, teal, wheatgrass

Modway’s midcentury couch is one of our favorite Prime-able couches on Amazon. It has a relatively small footprint for tight spaces, and balances on solid wood legs, with a middle-of-the-road seat depth that works for petites and people of average height. It also arrives in a handy slipcover when it ships out, so your sofa stays clean and pristine en route.

AllModern Aquarius Upholstered Sofa

  • Dimensions: 32.7'' H X 85.1'' W X 37.8'' D
  • Seat depth: 30.3''
  • Materials: Velvet, foam, rubberwood, pine
  • Colors: Rust, pistachio, light gray, light blue

AllModern’s Aquarius sofa isn’t quite as rebellious as the star sign it’s named after, with its modern lines and bountiful cushions that cater to a wide crowd. Still, it’s got the depth to suit the name, at least when it comes to seating. It’s deep enough to really sink into when you’re dialed into a show, though shorter folks might want to choose alternative options. It’s also firm-leaning to appeal to people who want a sturdier surface to sit on.

Wrought Studio Arnya Minimore Sofa

  • Dimensions: 30.7'' H X 84.6'' W X 33.9'' D
  • Seat depth: 24.4"
  • Materials: Polyester, solid + manufactured wood, foam
  • Colors: Gray Corduroy, Orange Chenille, Pink Corduroy, White Chenille, White Corduroy, Yellow Chenille

This cloud-like couch with over 400 five-star reviews to its credit is another intriguing option for anyone looking for maximum coziness. The sofa comes with five small round cushions that match the fluffy chenille surface and ship out in two boxes for easy assembly. At around $500, it’s a particularly nice entry-level prospect if you’re looking to experiment with the white couch lifestyle (like model Taylor Hill), but don’t want to splurge on something that might easily show stains.

Serta Rane Futon

  • Dimensions: 33.1"D x 66.1"W x 29.5"H
  • Seat depth: 19.8''
  • Materials: Microfiber, wood, metal, high density foam, polyester
  • Colors: Black, navy, charcoal, java, light gray

When your budget is only $200 for a new sofa (no judgement), you could go straight to Craigslist, but chances are you just want something free of dust and wear. The mattress specialists over at Serta have just the thing: a very cheap futon made up of high-density foam and coiled springs that acts like a firm mattress. Blessed with a midcentury look, it’s the ideal not-so-expensive find for folding down in a spare room or den when you have guests come through.

West Elm Penn Sofa

  • Dimensions: 87"W x 29.5"D x 30.75"H
  • Seat depth: 20.5"
  • Materials: Kiln-dried solid pine and engineered wood frame, metal legs, high-resiliency polyurethane foam cushions, chenille upholstery (65% polyester, 35% recycled polyester)
  • Colors: Slate

The three-seater Penn Sofa from West Elm comes in a blue-gray velvet. What it lacks in customization options, it makes up for in comfort and affordability. It comes optimally cushioned with high armrests and bold, spindly metal legs.

Pottery Barn Teen Cushy Lounge Sectional Set

  • Dimensions: 64"W x 64"D x 21.5"H
  • Seat depth: 24"
  • Materials: Plywood and LVL frame with foam, polyester batting and fabric
  • Colors: 26 colors across six different fabric types

Modular sofas like this L-shaped one are great if you want to move your furniture around, break things down into multiple single-seaters sprinkled around the room, or keep it all connected for cuddly movie nights. The possibilities are endless with how you can configure these three pieces, as well as the color and performance fabrics you can purchase them in (you can have the velvet couch of your dreams!).

West Elm Mella Sofa

  • Dimensions: 67.3"W x 33.3"D x 28.7"H
  • Seat depth: 24.8"
  • Materials: Engineered wood frame, solid rubberwood legs, cushions have fiber-wrapped, high-resiliency polyurethane foam cores, velvet or bouclé upholstery
  • Colors: Clay, alabaster

Performance velvet, a lovely curved silhouette, and a little peek of rubberwood legs make this the kind of piece of furniture that becomes a focal point of any living space it’s parked in. Great for small apartments, the design looks high-end while maintaining minimal charm (thank you, velvet). It does run on the firmer side, which is something to keep in mind. But if you’re in the market for a comfortable sofa that’s perfect for reading, watching a movie, or hanging out with friends, well…you found it. The cushions are attached, and it’s recommended that any stains are spot-cleaned.

Burrow Range 2-Piece Sofa

  • Dimensions: 62"L x 31"D x 28"H
  • Seat depth: 21"
  • Materials: Bent plywood frame, cushions use a combination of medium-density foam, shredded fill, and fiber wadding, stain-resistant fabric
  • Colors: Stone gray, heather charcoal, navy blue, moss green, ocean, toast

Burrow aims to cut out unnecessary markups while manufacturing highly customizable products with upcycled fabrics and sustainable wood. This small-space-friendly two-seater is our top choice because it’s completely customizable, from the colorways and arms to the legs (we reviewed the three-piece here).

The Best Affordable Couches Between $1,000 — $1,500

Quince Sierra Curved Arm Sofa

  • Dimensions: 30.5"H x 84"W x 40"D
  • Seat depth: 24"
  • Materials: Solid wood and kiln-dried engineered wood, foam and recycled fiber, velvet or performance fabric
  • Colors: Sable, ivory, linen, gunmetal, java, caramel, rust, spruce, midnight

We’ve tested lots of essentials from Quince, so we can personally vouch for the brand’s quality. In addition to reasonably-priced sheets and loungewear, it also recently ventured into furniture. The Sierra sofa comes in three different sizes, from seven to nine feet, to accommodate different floor plans, and there's a wide range of upholstery options to curate a lighter vibe or build out a moodier space.

Article Abisko Velvet Sofa

  • Dimensions: 28"H x 91"W x 35"D
  • Seat depth: 25"
  • Materials: Frame: kiln-dried larch, plywood, brushed aluminum; Filling: high density foam, polyester fiber; Fabric: 100% polyester
  • Colors: Pacific blue, Yarrow gold

The plush armrests on this velveteen Article sofa look like the perfect place to curl up for a nap or with a good book. The textured upholstery will inject some richness into your space, while the performance fabric makes it easy to blot out the odd stain or smudge if your living room doubles as your dining room.

AllModern Luka Sofa

  • Dimensions: 30.3'' H X 84.6'' W X 39.4'' D
  • Seat depth: 39.4"
  • Materials: Frame: solid wood, Filling: foam, Fabric: polyester blend
  • Colors: Mark cobalt, Pasha dune

And just because you’re buying a budget sofa, doesn’t mean it has to feel like a boring beater couch. This elevated sofa in a universally flattering beige features recessed arms and a graduated base in lieu of rickety legs. It’s also made of solid wood, not MDF, despite the approachable price point.

Article Sanders Velvet Sofa

  • Dimensions: 32.5"H x 85.5"W x 38.5"D
  • Seat depth: 21.5"
  • Materials: Frame: solid pine, solid beech, plywood; Filling: polyurethane foam, polyester fiber; Fabric: 100% polyester
  • Colors: Pacific green, Pacific brown

Oval velvet seat cushions make up the base and back of this squishy Article couch that beckons you to sit and sprawl out. The thin Scandi-style legs are just long enough that you can stuff some storage bins under there where the dust bunnies live, and the polyester fabric is low-absorption, so if you get a little too wild with your red wine or coffee, there’s still time to make a dash for some paper towels before it’s fully seeped in.

West Elm Leroy Loveseat

  • Dimensions: 60"W x 32"D x 25.8"H
  • Seat depth: 24.4"
  • Materials: Solid and engineered wood frame, cushion has a fiber-wrapped, high-resiliency polyurethane foam core, upholstery (linen, velvet, or chenille options)
  • Colors: Camel, silver, taupe, frost gray

If there’s anything West Elm does well, it’s a velvet sofa, and Leroy is just the comfy love seat for cozying up with someone or just cozying up with the special someone that is Netflix. Leroy is available in a soft velvet like the one pictured here or a number of finishes like linen, twill and chenille (so you can customize it for whatever living area it’s about to bless).

Article Abisko Sofa

  • Dimensions: 28"H x 91"W x 35"D
  • Seat depth: 25"
  • Materials: Kiln-dried larch, plywood, and brushed aluminum frame, high density foam and polyester fiber filling, poly-blend upholstery
  • Colors: Quartz white, Welsh gray

We love all things overstuffed (hello, cloud couch trend) because they offer supreme comfort. This option from Article arrives in two separate pieces for easy moving and assembly. It has wide, cushioned armrests which can double as a pillow in a pinch. If you’re in need of a sofa that’s neutral but still ultra-comfortable, look no further.

West Elm Osborn Sofa

  • Dimensions: 82"W x 39.5"D x 29"H
  • Seat depth: 27.5"
  • Materials: Kiln-dried engineered wood frame, cushions have fiber-wrapped, high-resiliency polyurethane foam cores, upholstery (linen, basketweave, velvet, chenille, bouclé, and twill options)
  • Colors: 34 colorways across the six fabric options

Consider this puffy pick the Cloud Couch’s cousin. Just looking at West Elm’s Osborn sofa makes us feel relaxed and ready to curl up. The exaggerated curves feel playful, though don't and it’s firm without being uninviting. Choose from a number of fabric styles and color options, from a sandy bouclé to gray performance velvet.

Albany Park Albany Leather Sofa

  • Dimensions: 87"W x 32"H x 34"D
  • Seat depth: 23"
  • Materials: Kiln-dried hardwood frame, cushions have pocket coils surrounded by high-density, mattress-quality memory foam, vegan leather
  • Colors: Distressed, rust

Albany Park’s signature three-seater faux leather couch is a dream for anyone who loves the look and feel of real cowskin. We can't ignore all the luxurious hues of velvet upholstery available, if that's more your style though. Plus it’s the ideal size for stretching out and reclining.

Castlery Jonathan Right Chaise

  • Dimensions: 54.7"W x 39.4D" x 27.6"H
  • Seat depth: 24.8"
  • Materials: Laminated veneer lumber & plywood frame, foam, fiber, pocket springs, poly-blend upholstery
  • Colors: Creamy white, Zenith blue, dark granite

This modern chaise is technically one part of Castlery’s modular sofas, but it can certainly stand alone in a room with other seating. It comes in a few neutral shades, as well. Push it up against a wall or nestle it near a side table, and expect a nice alternative to poufs and other low-lying seating.

Caitlin Loveseat by The Everygirl

  • Dimensions: 63"W x 37D" x 31"H
  • Seat depth: 22"
  • Materials: Wood frame, custom fill (down blend, double down blend, down alternative options), upholstery (velvet, chenille, linen, woven, tweed, slub weave, and bouclé options)
  • Colors: 124 color options across seven fabric types

We’re huge fans of Interior Define’s Gaby sectional, and the brand also offers several sofas in the under $2,000 price range. The Caitlin is customizable when it comes to color, fabric, leg type, cushion type, depth, fill, and size. The Caitlin has a classic shape, but the deep-toned upholstery adds a vintage element that'll stand out in your living room.

Urban Outfitters Roma Sofa

  • Dimensions: 74.8"L x 33.46"W x 30"H
  • Seat depth: 26"
  • Materials: Rubberwood, pinewood, plywood, fabric
  • Colors: Red stripe, moss, ivory, sky, yellow stripe

The curvy bottom edge alone sold us on this one (along with the gorgeous hue). It’s playful, it’s modern, and has a soothing color and design. Plus, without any arms to speak of, it's easier to fit in tighter spaces. Fill it with throw pillows and get ready for some cozy naps.

Albany Park Kova Sofa

  • Dimensions: 85.5"W x 39"H x 42.5"D
  • Seat depth: 29"
  • Materials: Contract-grade wood frame, foam, upholstery (linen, chenille, canvas, bouclé, velvet, twill, and basketweave options)
  • Colors: 33 colors across all fabric types

For anyone decorating a smaller space who still wants to provide a cozy spot to nap, this pick from Albany Park certainly fits the bill. Prepare to sink into the deep hypoallergenic foam cushions for hours on end. You can choose from different fabric options—including stain-resistant, pet-friendly, and kid-friendly—all of which come in a handful of different colors.

The Best Affordable Couches Between $1,500 — $2,000

Article Nordby Sofa Bed

  • Dimensions: 33"H x 87"W x 35"D
  • Seat depth: 29.5"
  • Materials: Rubberwood, plywood, steel, foam, polyester fiber, polyester upholstery
  • Colors: Henge gray, lull blue, pep gray

Article’s Nordby took the top spot in our list of the finest sofa beds for its attractive price point and easily convertible frame that folds out into a full-size pullout bed. Its minimal look and chunky legs are easy to swallow when you’re on a tight budget and, though the sofa itself is decently firm, your guest can at least relish the fact that they’re not on a saggy air mattress when they’re sprawled out on it.

Crate & Barrel Cavett Ash Wood Loveseat

  • Dimensions: 33"H x 51"W x 31"D
  • Materials: Soy-based polyfoam and fiber, solid ash
  • Colors: 219 colors across the fabric types

For the person who wants a vintage-leaning piece without the hassle of haggling on 1st Dibs, there’s this mid-century Scandi loveseat that clocks in at just under $1,500. Its slender arms and cantilevered seat invite you to sit back and relax, while the solid ash frame ensures that it will be with you for the long haul.

Cozey Atmosphere Collection Sofa

  • Dimensions: 28.3"H x 110.6"W x 40.6"D
  • Materials: Solid pine, high density foam, performance fabric, chenille
  • Colors: 15 colors across the fabric types

You can always add more pieces to Cozey’s modular Atmosphere sofa, making it a great option for anyone looking for furniture that can adapt to their home. “I would definitely want to bring it with me to a new home, especially since it would be easy to break down into pieces and transport with a moving van,” reviewer Adrienne Jordan told us when she first reviewed the piece. Performance fabric, chenille, and boucle upholstery options further solidify its reign as one of the most customizable options on this list, and there’s even an option to nix the armrests for a more streamlined, modern look.

Sabai The Essential Sofa

  • Dimensions: 32"H x 85"W x 34"D
  • Seat depth: 22"
  • Materials: FSC Certified wood, high resiliency foam, 100% recycled fabrics (hemp blend, cactus leather, recycled velvet, upcycled polyester, and hemp options)
  • Colors: 22 colors across the fabric types

Not only does the Essential Sofa from Sabai have a fairly wallet-friendly price tag, it also has serious sustainability cred. The solid wood frame is made of FSC-certified lumber, the foam-filling is CertiPUR-certified, and the pillows are made of recycled fiber fill. Plus it leans into a classic silhouette that’ll fit any decor style, featuring square arms and one long foam cushion. It’s a green flag in our book!

Crate & Barrel Pacific Armless Sofa with Wood Legs

  • Dimensions: 17.5"H x 71.5"W x 23"D
  • Seat depth: 23"
  • Materials: FSC-certified solid and engineered hardwood, high-resilient foam wrapped in polyfiber, upholstery (chenille, textured weave, microfiber, linen weave, twill, velvet, canvas, bouclé, plain weave, shearling)
  • Colors: 262 colors across the fabric types

Anything with cute, chunky legs is going to add some personality to your space—and make it look more expensive. This armless seat is anchored by square, wooden legs and you even get to choose between a variety of color ways (we love the look of natural rubberwood). The taller back cushion offers up some serious support, whether you’re lounging or working. Plus, the armless construction means the couch will prove a little easier to fit into tighter spaces.

CB2 Strato Velvet Sofa

  • Dimensions: 27.5"H x 80"W x 38"D
  • Seat depth: 26.75"
  • Materials: Kiln-dried engineered wood, high density foam cushions, cotton-poly blend velvet upholstery
  • Colors: Camel, white

We’ll give you a second to take in this ‘70s-inspired beauty. Yes, it comes in right at $1,999, but it makes a statement without being so trendy you’ll want to sell it on Facebook Marketplace next year. Framed in solid wood and ensconced in camel velvet, this two-seater sofa lasts for the long haul.
